thread.title: Lena Dunham to host ‘Women of the Hour’ BuzzFeed podcast
thread.title_full: Lena Dunham to host ‘Women of the Hour’ BuzzFeed podcast - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Lena Dunham to host ‘Women of the Hour’ BuzzFeed podcast
text:
Charles Sykes/Invision/AP Lena Dunham has partnered with BuzzFeed to launch a new podcast called "Women of the Hour." "Girls" creator Lena Dunham will now be the voice of a generation — literally.
The 29-year-old comedy writer has partnered with BuzzFeed to host a "feminist variety-hour" podcast called "Women of the Hour," which will explore friendship, productivity, sex and dating, activism and other topics, she announced Tuesday on Twitter .
"Please subscribe if you like bad-asses, deep questions, giggling, sexual healing, Gaia life force, style, summer-camp, cute kids, the Internet and feminine power," Dunham wrote of the podcast, which she created with BuzzFeed Director of Audio Jenna Weiss-Berman.
Evan Agostini/Invision/AP "Women of the Hour" will feature conversations with an "all-lady pod-squad," including Dunham's "Girls" co-star Jemima Kirke (r.).
The podcast, whose five-episode first season debuts Nov. 5, will feature conversations with an "all-lady pod-squad" — including actresses Emma Stone, Amy Sedaris and Jemima Kirke; "SNL" cast member Aidy Bryant; author Zadie Smith; transgender rights activist Janet Mock and Bay Area girls' activist group the Radical Monarchs.
Stone will explain the innumerable meanings of the word "dude," Sedaris will explore her friendship with fashion designer Todd Oldham, and Smith will teach listeners how to avoid falling into a "Beyoncé Google hole" at work, according to a five-minute preview posted Tuesday.
Each of the five episodes will feature a different theme, according to Dunham, "plus a bunch of bonus interviews, radio dramas — the whole shebang."
Fans of the ubiquitous indie filmmaker can now feast on her content in myriad ways.
